alert.note: Alert for Los Angeles (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued December 23 at 6:30PM PST by NWS Oxnard
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1230 AM PST FRIDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southwest California, including the following county, western Los Angeles. * WHEN...Until 1230 AM PST Friday. * IMPACTS...Heavy rainfall could trigger shallow debris flows in and near recent wildfire burn scars such as the Palisades and North burn areas. Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas will be possible. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 623 PM PST, Doppler radar indicated widespread moderate rain moving into the area. Rainfall rates of 0.25 to 0.50 inch per hour will be possible at times, with locally higher rates. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Malibu, Chatsworth, Northridge, Woodland Hills, Van Nuys, Santa Clarita, North Hollywood, Agoura Hills, Santa Monica, Canoga Park, Granada Hills, Sylmar, and near the Palisades and North burn scars. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Move away from recently burned areas. The rain will likely trigger shallow mud and debris flows, minor rock falls, and flooding capable of localized damage, especially in steep terrain in and near burn scars. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
